data.name: Xfinity
data.contact_address: Not publicly listed; service centers are available in the local area.
data.description: Xfinity, a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation, provides high-speed internet services with a wide range of plans to suit different needs. They offer additional services like Xfinity Mobile and have a network of WiFi hotspots for their customers.
data.emergency_steps:
- Step 1: Check if there is a known service outage in your area by visiting the Xfinity Response Center.  
- Step 2: If there is no outage reported, restart your modem, router, and/or TV box.  
- Step 3: If power is out, wait for the local utility provider to restore power before Xfinity services can be restored.  
- Step 4: Sign up for text alerts via your Xfinity account to receive updates on service restoration.  
- Step 5: Use Xfinity WiFi hotspots to stay connected if your home service is disrupted xfinity.com/learn/internet-service/wifi#WiFiMap.

Non-Emergency Tips:  
- Tip 1: Use the Xfinity My Account app to manage your services and troubleshoot issues.  
- Tip 2: Ensure your contact information is up-to-date in your Xfinity account to receive timely service updates and alerts.
data.non_emergency_tips:
- Tip 1: Use the Xfinity My Account app to manage your services and troubleshoot issues.  
- Tip 2: Ensure your contact information is up-to-date in your Xfinity account to receive timely service updates and alerts.
